data.title: MTV vs. VH1
data.meta_description:
Yeah..another one of those comparison threads.. :p 

So..which one DO you like better? I prefer VH1...they aren't as..how do I say it... stupid as MTV is...
data.text:
Bird Boy

WF Admin

Joined

Apr 27, 2001

Messages

19,124

Location

Depth's of World's Finest

Aug 21, 2001

#1

Yeah..another one of those comparison threads..

So..which one DO you like better? I prefer VH1...they aren't as..how do I say it... stupid as MTV is. MTV plays the worst shows..and....MTV does stand for "Music Television" right? Cuz..well...I RARELY see anything Musical on it. You ever seen "Undressed" ? That has jack squat about music on it......

-BB

Trent Lane

How can that be?!

Joined

Jun 2, 2001

Messages

4,325

Location

Marlinton, West Virginia,

Aug 21, 2001

#2

VH1 is definetly better. At least the hows they have are entertaining and intresting. MTV is all aobut "NSYNC's Most Awesomest Videos" or something like that. You know what I mean...

Calhoun07

It's Me

Joined

May 3, 2001

Messages

18,562

Location

KCMO

Aug 21, 2001

#3

MTV has nothing I like to watch right now. Are they going to be doing new episodes of Undergrads? They have so much potential, but I think they waste it on shows like Jackass and Undressed. Undressed is the worst series ever, with lower production standards than day time soaps. I hate that show!

VH1 has better series, and I like several of their original movies. I am also really looking forward to the new Strange Frequencies series. I will be sure to watch that to see how it is!

But does anybody here have MTV2? They play a great variety of music, and I hear new songs way before the radio stations around here are calling them "new."

Joe Tully

I want the toilet seat.

Joined

May 4, 2001

Messages

8,406

Location

Massachusetts

Aug 21, 2001

#4

VH1. I really don't care for the current trends in music (boy bands, Britney, etc.) or the frankly stupid stuff that MTV runs like Undressed, Jackass, etc. Plus, Behind the Music is always interesting, even if it's about someone you don't really like. I watched the entire episode on Vanilla Ice, for chrissake! Pop Up Video is fun too. I don't watch a whole lot of music-related TV (is MTV still music-related?) but when I do it's usually VH1, or on rare occasions MTV2 which has some good videos. I agree with Calhoun, I think they show some older stuff on there, it is much better than MTV.

Colin

Oh... this is not good.

Joined

Apr 22, 2001

Messages

5,382

Location

Brick, NJ

Aug 21, 2001

#5

Not sure which to say, because I usually only watch either network when they play actual music... and I mean full songs, not the 1/4-song-crap you see on TRL... of course that's usually at like 3 AM =X

However, if I were to turn my tv to a music channel during the daylight hours, it would probably go to VH1. They manage to keep their "non-music" programming music oriented, unlike MTV who'll do anything for ratings... I do, however, try to tune in to the not-so-"Real World" on MTV every Thursday... pretty much the only reality TV I'll watch... altho, I've seen bits of that Murder in Small Town X show and that seemed kinda intriguing... but that's a whole 'nother issue...

The Dork Knight

Celebrity Deathmatch

I only like TRL when they have GOOD music videos.

WWF Sunday Night Heat

#7

Real World's on Tuesdays! :O) But yeah, aside from having Real World, MTV's got nothing on VH1. They got rid of 120 Minutes! It was their best music show. I think it's on MTV2 now, but lucky me--I don't have it! :O(

Location

Toonzone

Aug 21, 2001

#8

Neither. While I get both MTV and VH-1 I can't stand either. I prefer the Canuck channel Muchmusic becuase they actually play music. They only have about 2 - 3 hours a day of non-music oriented programming. The rest of the day is made up of music blocks. PLus we get specific blocks of punk music, rock, rapheavy stuff, techno, pop, etc...and the top 30 countdown. I think Muchmusic plays more music in a day than MTV does in a week.

DarkAngel

Ohio

Aug 21, 2001

#9

Originally posted by DickGrayson

Neither. While I get both MTV and VH-1 I can't stand either.

I haven't watched either in a while, but in the past I've preferred VH1 because it had better programming. At the moment, I'm not sure if that's still true or not. I like Behind the Music, The List (which may not be on anymore), and a lot of the concert footage they've shown. I'm a huge Beatles fan and on many occassions they've shown Beatles videos, McCartney concerts and interviews, etc. I've loved that.

The Mad Hatter

Whyyyyy'sis heead so biiiiiig?

Middle o' the U.S.

Aug 21, 2001

#10

The one that actually shows videos on a regular basis. Wait, that's neither of them.

VH1 usually annoys me less, since MTV tries to be too hip for its own good. I thought my frustration with that channel was because I'm rapidly becoming an old fart, but the younger folks I've talked to have noticed the same things.

M2 is a godsend... but if they only showed it around here! I know a friend whose parents (across the state) get it, and every time he visits he takes a tape, pops it in the VCR and records M2 for eight hours or so.

Then again, I hear MTV is really going to revive its animation block, so maybe there's hope.

I perfer neither. I watch MuchMusic USA and I'm hoping I'll get MTV2. A 24 - hr. music network, who would've thought? LOL...

I love the Andy Dick show on MTV, best thing on there. Besides that I sometimes watch Real World and maybe Spyder Games. As for music videos, I have my TiVo setup to record them so it doesn't matter what time they're on - I'll watch'm whenever I feel like it and fast forward through the crap.

Another thing MTV2 has going for it...120 Minutes!!!! And they often have some good concerts on after wards.
